definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: He didn’t get off his stool and bang it on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他并没有离开高脚凳并用其敲击地面。

sentences.english: MAN on a barstool SLAPS the WOMAN he's with.
sentences.chinese: 一个坐在高脚凳上的男人打了和他一起的女人一巴掌。

sentences.english: Your feet should be flat on the floor or supported by a footrest.
sentences.chinese: 你的脚应该平放在地板上或用一个脚凳支持。

sentences.english: 43until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.
sentences.chinese: 等我使你仇敌作你的脚凳。

sentences.english: Let us go into his tent; let us give worship at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 我们要进他的居所，在他脚凳前下拜。

sentences.english: And he used the extinct volcano as a foot-stool.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经使用那座死火山当做脚凳。

sentences.english: Here is thy footstool and there rest thy feet where live the poorest, and lowliest, and lost.
sentences.chinese: 您在最贫最贱最失所的人群中歇足，这是您的脚凳。

sentences.english: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
sentences.chinese: 等我使你仇敌作你的脚凳。

sentences.english: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
sentences.chinese: 等我使你的仇敌作你的脚凳。

sentences.english: If necessary, prop up your feet with a footstool or other support.
sentences.chinese: 如有必要，用脚凳或其它支持物垫起双脚。

sentences.english: Heb. 10:13 Henceforth waiting until His enemies are made the footstool for His feet.
sentences.chinese: 来十13从此等候他的仇敌，放在他的脚下作脚凳。

sentences.english: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.
sentences.chinese: 从此等候他仇敌成了他的脚凳。

sentences.english: We were led to a room lined wtih easy chairs and foot stools.
sentences.chinese: 我们被领到一个房间里，里面排着舒服的椅子和脚凳。

sentences.english: The ark then is said to serve as his footstool.
sentences.chinese: 方舟则是作为他的脚凳。

sentences.english: Cathy carried a footstool and her cup to his side.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂搬来一个脚凳，拿着自己的茶杯，走到他身边去。

sentences.english: The dining room opens into the kitchen and has an island with barstool seating.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅通向厨房和酒吧高脚凳座位一个岛。
